title: Compression Scaling Laws
research_question: What is the functional form of compression scaling, and does it predict behavior at unseen graph sizes?

P1.name: Monotonic Scaling
P1.description: δ increases monotonically with N for LR correlations
P1.rationale: If compression is real, larger graphs = more compression

P2.name: Functional Form - Logarithmic
P2.rationale: Many geometric scaling laws are logarithmic

P4.name: Saturation Test
P4.rationale: If effect is geometric, should continue growing

P5.name: Predictive Validity
P5.description: Model fitted on N ≤ 500 predicts δ(1000) within 20%
P5.rationale: A valid scaling law should extrapolate

P6.name: Improved Baseline
P6.description: With continuous dimension estimation, baseline variance drops
